title: How to Make a Jam Sandwich

steps.headline: Place the slices of bread on the plate.
Spread a spoonful of jam or preserves on one side of each slice of bread.
Press the slices of bread together.
Cut in halves or quarters.
steps.description: Quarters are easiest to handle if the jam is really chunky or threatens to ooze out.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Put on a plate for serving.

steps.headline: Place the slices of sandwich bread on the plate.
Spread the jam or preserves over the slices.
Press the slices together.
Remove the crusts from the sandwich bread.
Cut into neat rectangles or finger sticks.
Arrange neatly on a plate or a sandwich/cake stand.

methods.name: Grilled Jam and Cream Cheese Sandwich

steps.headline: Place the slices of sandwich bread on a work surface.
Spread the cream cheese on 2 bread slices.
Spread the strawberry jam or preserves on the other 2 slices.
Press the 2 slices together.
steps.description: Press one cream cheese to one strawberry jam/preserves slice.

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a frying pan or skillet.
Spread butter over the top of each sandwich.
Put the buttered sandwiches into the frying pan/skillet.
steps.description: Fry over medium heat until the base turns golden brown. This will be about 4 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Flip over and fry the other side.
Remove from the heat when golden brown both sides.
steps.description: Plate up and serve. Allow the diner to cut the sandwich; the cheese will ooze a little. Be careful; jam or preserves retain heat well.

steps.headline: Place the slices of sandwich bread on the plate.
Spread the nut butter on one slice.
Spread the jam or preserves on the other slice.
Press the two slices together.
Serve.
